meanings.definition: The beliefs, practices, or characteristic features of a stylite.
meanings.sent1: The stylitisms of the ancient monk were deeply rooted in solitude and prayer.
meanings.sent2: Many historians study the stylitisms of different religious figures throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The stylitisms of the hermit were so extreme that he only spoke to birds perched on his pillar.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to the stylitisms of her faith was as unwavering as the pillar she stood upon.
meanings.sent5: The stylitisms of the ascetic were as tall and unyielding as the pillar he called home.

meanings.definition: The act or practice of living on top of a pillar as a form of religious asceticism.
meanings.sent1: Living a life of stylitisms requires great physical endurance and spiritual dedication.
meanings.sent2: The stylitisms of the monk inspired awe and admiration among the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The stylitisms of the young acolyte were met with both curiosity and concern by the townspeople.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to the stylitisms of her faith was as unwavering as the pillar she stood upon.
meanings.sent5: The stylitisms of the ascetic were as tall and unyielding as the pillar he called home.
